Generation VIII.Sword: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.
Generation VIII.Shield: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Its large front tooth is still growing in. When the tooth itches, this Pokémon will bite another Chewtle’s horn, and the two Pokémon will tussle.
Generation IX.Violet: A popular game among children is to lift up sticks that Chewtle have bitten onto to see whose Chewtle can hang on the longest.

Generation VIII.Sword: Routes 2 , 4 and 5 , Galar Mine No. 2 , Giant's Cap , Giant's Mirror , Hulbury , Motostoke , Motostoke Outskirts , Motostoke Riverbank Bridge Field , Dusty Bowl , East Lake Axewell , Giant's Cap , Giant's Mirror , Lake of Outrage , South Lake Miloch , West Lake Axewell ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Routes 2 , 4 and 5 , Galar Mine No. 2 , Giant's Cap , Giant's Mirror , Hulbury , Motostoke , Motostoke Outskirts , Motostoke Riverbank Bridge Field , Dusty Bowl , East Lake Axewell , Giant's Cap , Giant's Mirror , Lake of Outrage , South Lake Miloch , West Lake Axewell ( Max Raid Battle )

Generation IX.Scarlet: South Province: Area One , Area Two , Area Four , Area Five East Province: Area Two , Area Three West Province: Area One , Area Two North Province: Area Two Tera Raid Battles ( 1★ )
Generation IX.Violet: South Province: Area One , Area Two , Area Four , Area Five East Province: Area Two , Area Three West Province: Area One , Area Two North Province: Area Two Tera Raid Battles ( 1★ )
